page.title: 14TOURISM
page.content: The beautiful Pittencrieff Glen is probably the main tourist attraction of Dunfermline. Within the Glen there is a large number of things to see, such as the Music Pavilion, Pittencrieff House, the cafe, greenhouses with tropical plants, the Carnegie monument, the old locomotive,paddling pools and many animals including peacocks, rabbits, donkeys, goats, guinea pigs, fish and a large variety of birds in an aviary. Another prominent feature of Dunfermline is the Abbey. It is made of brick and stone, but the brick and stone is beginning to crumble and because of this the Abbey has to be closed for a while so that it can be repaired. Visitors to the Abbey can see a glass case with the remains of King Robert the Bruce in it.
